definition: to go out to sea/(neologism) to expand into overseas markets

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: EVERY evening the young Fisherman went out upon the sea, and threw his nets into the water.
sentences.chinese: 每晚，年轻的渔夫都要出海打鱼，将他的网撒进水里。

sentences.english: When I'd go out with the dinghy, manta ray would escort me, dolphins.
sentences.chinese: 当我划着小舢板出海时，蝠鲼和海豚会为我护航。

sentences.english: But he also goes to sea actually in 85th days catches fish.
sentences.chinese: 而他却还在第八十五天出海捕鱼。

sentences.english: Today, dad and every family members were very busy preparing for setting off for fishing.
sentences.chinese: 今天，爸爸和家人都忙于准备出海捕鱼。

sentences.english: Fish boats are the main tools of fishing for fisherman.
sentences.chinese: 渔船是渔民出海捕鱼的主要工具。

sentences.english: It was insane to take the boat on the sea in that storm.
sentences.chinese: 那末大的风暴乘划子出海，的确是疯了。

sentences.english: He first went to sea in 1505.
sentences.chinese: 他第一次出海航行是1505年。

sentences.english: I still wear it sometimes, but only at sea.
sentences.chinese: 我现在有时还会穿，不过仅仅是在出海时。

sentences.english: Bernie knew about piracy, because he was an oceangoing person.
sentences.chinese: 伯尼对海盗有所了解，因为他喜欢出海。

sentences.english: Its nearest seaports are in Guangdong Province and Guangxi Province.
sentences.chinese: 出海口主要是中国广东和广西。

sentences.english: One goes to sea and the other becomes Vice President of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 一个儿子出海谋生，另一个儿子成为美国副总统。

sentences.english: Dr Hopkins is a small boy, he was eager and enthusiastic about the sea treasure hunt .
sentences.chinese: 何金斯是一个小男孩，他渴望并且热衷于出海寻宝。

sentences.english: He went to sea at 16, and, in the off-season, to school to study fishing.
sentences.chinese: 他16岁出海捕鱼，在淡季则去学校学习捕鱼知识。

sentences.english: Temple, which is within the Poseidon empress sea fishermen sacrifice the gods places.
sentences.chinese: 庙内供奉海神娘娘，是出海渔民祭祀神明的场所。

sentences.english: The river runneth softly to the sea.
At present the only exit that the Russians had was Murmansk.
sentences.chinese: 目前俄国人唯一的出海口就是摩尔曼斯克。

definition: to go out to sea/to enter the sea (to swim etc)/(fig.) to take the plunge (e.g. leave a secure job, or enter prostitution etc)
East China Sea/East Sea (Chinese mythology and ancient geography)
(of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
to travel a great distance by sea or air/voyage/long-haul flight
